rescuecore2.misc.java

Class LoadableType

  • java.lang.Object
    • rescuecore2.misc.java.LoadableType

  • public class LoadableType
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains information about a type that can be detected in a jar manifest or class file. For example, a MessageFactory implementation in a jar file can be designated in the jar manifest under a "MessageFactory" attribute, or implementation classes could be inferred by looking for a class name regular expression like "(.*MessageFactory).class". Classes in the jar file can be inspected and checked to see if they extend (or implement) a particular class (interface).

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoadableType

        public LoadableType(java.lang.String manifestKey,
            java.lang.String regex,
            java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Construct a new LoadableType.
        Parameters:
        manifestKey - The key to look for in a jar manifest for this type.
        regex - A regex to use for determining if a class name should be tested.
        clazz - A superclass for checking if candidate classes should be extracted.

    • Method Detail

      • processManifest

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> processManifest(java.util.jar.Manifest mf)
        Inspect a jar manifest and extract the entries in the manifestKey attribute if it exists. This method will check that entries also specify valid class names.
        Parameters:
        mf - The manifest to check.
        Returns:
        A list of class names.

      • processJarEntry

        public java.lang.String processJarEntry(java.util.jar.JarEntry e)
        Inspect an entry in a jar file and see if it names a conformant class.
        Parameters:
        e - The JarEntry to check.
        Returns:
        The class name, or null if the entry does not name a conformant class.
